name: Eastern Cliffs
economy_niches: cliffside ship repair, caulking and hull-salvage
transshipment and short-term storage of imported ritual reagents
terraced coastal orchards and salt-tolerant produce
culture_adjustments: guild dominance by lighthouse and pilot associations over inland merchants
oral tradition specialized for signal codes and fog-signals
ritual practices focused on tide-warding and cliff-spirits
greater suspicion of longshore caravans; heavy local patronage networks
constraints: limited arable land and fresh water
difficult overland access for large wagons
ritual reagent storage regulated by guild charters
notes: local pilots legally required for passage through cliff channels
seasonal fogs increase reliance on lighthouses and signal-music
